pli-tv-bu-vb-sk50:2.1: The monks’ rules and their analysis
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk50:6.1: At one time the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in the Jeta Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk50:6.2: At that time the monks from the group of six ate making a chomping sound. …
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk50:7.2: “‘I will not chomp while eating,’ this is how you should train.”
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk50:8.1: One should not chomp while eating.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk50:8.2: If a monk out of disrespect chomps while eating, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk50:9.2: if it is unintentional; if he is not mindful; if he does not know; if he is sick; if there are dangers; if he is insane;
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk50:9.3: if he is the first offender.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk50:10.1: The tenth training rule is finished.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk50:10.2: The fifth chapter on mouthfuls is finished.
